head.supplied: 20th January 1858 ¶ ¶ By desire of the Chief Secretary I have the honor to forward the enclosed copies of the Instructions which it is proposed to issue to the Scientific Board in order that each of ...

div.p: From John Moore to the Secretary of the Board of Science
No. 127, unit 2, p. 222, VPRS 1187 outward correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

By desire of the Chief Secretary I have the honor to forward the enclosed copies of the Instructions which it is proposed to issue to the Scientific Board in order that each of the Members may have the opportunity of considering the Instructions and making such observations upon them as may appear desirable and as it is of importance that the Instructions should be issued without delay I am to state that Mr Haines would be glad to be made acquainted with the views of the Members thereupon with the least delay possible.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: The Secretary to the Board of Science
